question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, expert responses. Be sure the code you generate is executable when possible. Could you please help me create something about tourist attractions and cuisine in Hunan and Sichuan? Please provide me with the complete code.

checklist.title: Is the tourist attraction information system comprehensively implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements tourist attraction data display through HTML/JavaScript, including attraction details, geographic location, opening hours, ticket prices, and user ratings. Check if interactive maps are integrated and whether attraction filtering/searching functionality is provided. Score 0 if core attraction display is not implemented, 5 if only basic information is shown, and 10 if comprehensive attraction management with interactive features is fully included.

checklist.title: Is the cuisine information and recommendation system fully developed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the cuisine section includes detailed information about Hunan and Sichuan dishes, restaurants, cooking methods, and ingredients. Check if recipe details, restaurant locations, price ranges, and user reviews are implemented. Verify if cuisine categorization and recommendation algorithms are present. Deduct 5 points if recipe details are missing, and 3 points if restaurant information is incomplete. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the data structure design and content management system properly architected?
checklist.description: Assess whether the data structure efficiently organizes tourist and cuisine information using appropriate data models (JSON/database schema). Check if content management allows for easy updates, additions, and modifications of attractions and restaurants. Evaluate if search indexing and data relationships are properly established. Deduct 5 points if data structure is poorly designed, and 3 points if content management is not scalable. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are interactive features and user engagement mechanisms complete?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes user interaction features such as rating systems, comment sections, favorite lists, and trip planning tools. Evaluate if social sharing capabilities, photo galleries, and virtual tours are implemented. Verify if user preferences and personalized recommendations are supported. Deduct 5 points if basic interaction features are missing, and 3 points if user engagement tools are incomplete. Give 10 points if fully implemented.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as missing data, network interruption, invalid user input, image loading failures, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the user experience (e.g., 1. AR/VR virtual attraction tours 2. AI-powered personalized itinerary planning 3. Real-time weather integration 4. Multi-language support 5. Offline map functionality). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple search mechanisms coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to tourism/cuisine (e.g., built-in games or music players) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations or heavy graphics). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data layer/presentation layer/business logic), code organization, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 3 points if the file structure is poorly organized. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching reflecting regional culture (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional typography system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times) 4) High-quality images with consistent aspect ratios. Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for glaring color combinations, and 5 points for chaotic layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance 4) Smooth scrolling and image loading 5) Responsive design across devices. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual artifacts during interactions, and 5 points for hard-to-find navigation elements. The full score is 10 points.
